item.title: I keep getting this stupid error...look please
item.dc:creator: @mindtempest mindtempest
item.description:
@mindtempest wrote:

you dint declare x, which made SCAR declare it on its first usage. However, the second usage is a second declaration
to declare add var x:integer to the front. before begin

item.title: I keep getting this stupid error...look please
item.dc:creator: @Boreas Boreas
item.description:
@Boreas wrote:

Take out the include si.txt part (and comment loadinclude(woodcutter) because thats from si) and won’t get the error. SRL and si are conflicting because they both use x, so remove one of them. Hint: remove si, srl is better. Find an alternative procedure for loadinclude in SRL or just put loadinclude at the top of your script like the procedures you wrote (however you script will be longer).

Read full topic
item.source: I keep getting this stupid error...look please

item.title: I keep getting this stupid error...look please
item.dc:creator: @Westside_Rep Westside Rep
item.description:
@Westside_Rep wrote:

i keep getting this estupido error…
line 16: [Error] (2475:1) Duplicate identifier ‘x’ in script C:\PROGRAM FILES\SCAR 2.03\includes\srl\srl\core\globals.scar

[scar]program Woodcutter;
{.include si.txt}
{.include srl/srl.scar}
{.include srl/srl/skill/woodcutting.scar}
{.include par.txt}
//-----Setup-----\
const log=3438704; //Wood Colour
dropcolor=3826305; //log color
//------End------\

procedure Woodcutter;
begin
findcolorspiral(x,y,log,3,3,515,336)
mouse(x,y,0,0,true)
wait(5000+random(5000))
end;

procedure AutoDropped;
//this isnt finished yet…i dont think it matters though
begin

end;

begin
loadinclude(‘Woodcutter’)
repeat
Woodcutter;
AutoDropped
until(false)
end.[/scar]

what the heck is a matter with it…

Read full topic
item.source: I keep getting this stupid error...look please
